p: Please send my other false teeth. Broke that front tooth again!!

Reached Branson at noon Monday. The 1:30 A.M. bus didn't get started utnil 2:20 A.M. because of the crowd. There were three sections and I managed to crowd into the second. Didn't sleep any, but felt bully all night and ate a huge breakfast at Lebanon. Felt bully all day, too, but slept 12 hrs. last ngiht.
I do miss you three - felt just a bit homesick; but I'm glad to be here too. The place is beautiful and the growth of foliage is astonishing. The pasture grass is above my shoulders.

Amama is all right, but she is sick in spirit because of many things. Mama is in fine shape, and so is old Doc. He has taken a shine to Amama & seems to look after her, following her around. Amama is sweet altho' mention of Alice caused an unpleasant ten mintues. Too bad! But she is sweet & very heart - sick.
I wonder if old Nei will be coonversing fluently when I see him again! Golly, golly! What a people he is! I think I've never known a baby like him. Dog on it! Gaki wants to see him right now.
I think of you two with a soft warm glow. You are good - and very dear. Who knows? Maybe we'll have Capt. Penick's form or another is good!

Ollie, strangely enough, I saw better corn on the way down here - from Springfield on - than I saw in Illinois & Indiana. Considerably taller & rich in color. The rainy season in a well drained country, no doubt - and lime-stone soil - may have something to do with, this. Ordinarily it wouldn't be so.

Say, Ollie, I forgot to say that the mould must be well soaked before you pour the cement. Fill the mould with water & let it stand, say, 24 hrs. before you cast. Drain the mould before you pour the cement.
